The nemhaith is bound to a place or large stationary object and can't venture more than 500 feet from this focus.

A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Odrodzenie
action->Rejuvenation.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]

Destroying the ritual object or place used in the nemhaith's creation destroys the nemhaith, freeing its bound spirits to move on to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2k4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

action->Drain Life.name: Drain Life
action->Drain Life.description:
When the nemhaith damages a living creature with its spirit tendril Strike, the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 2}.

Further damage dealt by the nemhaith increases the condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

action->Rage of Spirits.name: Rage of Spirits
action->Rage of Spirits.description: The nemhaith's bound spirits rage and smash everything in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[4d6[sonic],4k6[void]]{4k6 sonic damage and 4k6 void damage} (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save).

action->Throw Spirits.name: Throw Spirits
action->Throw Spirits.description:
The nemhaith directs its bound spirits as a group to move up to 1 mile away (they have a fly Speed of 60 feet). The nemhaith can see and hear through the thrown spirits, but it loses its aura and can't use its spirit dart ranged Strike or Rage of Spirits.

The nemhaith regains these abilities when the spirits return to the nemhaith's space.

The Trial of Finality.name: The Trial of Finality
The Trial of Finality.description: A shaft of light shines from the ceiling to the floor in a ring of slowly churning smoke.
The Trial of Finality.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43] (master) to use tools to reflect and focus the light shining from above into the surrounding smoke to disperse it and the hazard's magical energies, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9. rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract the trial
The Trial of Finality.reset: Once the room is empty of living creatures, the trial deactivates and then resets after 1 minute has passed.
The Trial of Finality.routine:
(1 or 2 actions; emotion, fear, mental) If a creature in area B4 is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Nieprzytomny} as a result of A Quick Death, the trial's first action is to Sustain that paralysis or unconscious effect; the paralyzed or unconscious creature can attempt a new @Check[will|dc:38|traits:emotion,fear,mental] save at this time against this effect with the same potential results as detailed above for A Quick Death, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save. The Trial of Finality's second action is to manifest horrifying ghostly shapes in the smoke that shriek and telepathically threaten everyone in area B4, promising them their deaths are imminent. All creatures other than the paralyzed or unconscious creature currently enduring A Quick Death must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38|traits:emotion,fear,mental] save.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1}.

Porażka The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2}.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 3} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Uciekający} as long as they remain frightened.

action->A Quick Death.name: A Quick Death
action->A Quick Death.description:
Aktywator A living creature steps into the central 15-foot area of the room directly illuminated by light

Efekt The triggering creature momentarily becomes convinced they have been dead for a long time, and that the events of this adventure are but a hallucination. If the triggering creature has come close to death earlier in this adventure, they briefly believe that they didn't actually survive that encounter. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature shakes off the conviction that they are dead and realizes it was a magically induced hallucination. The Trial of Finality deactivates.

Sukces The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany}, and the conviction that they are dead and now watching, as a ghost, their companions from the middle of the room. The Trial of Finality rolls initiative, and the creature remains paralyzed until the end of the hazard's next turn.

Porażka As success, but the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Nieprzytomny} until the end of the trial's next turn instead of paralyzed. While unconscious, the creature experiences a dreamlike vision of being carried through the River of Souls toward the Boneyard, where their soul shall be judged.

Krytyczna Porażka As failure, but the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}, or increases the value of an existing doomed condition by 1. If the creature dies as a result of this, the Trial of Finality deactivates.

Trial of Tolerance.name: Trial of Tolerance
Trial of Tolerance.description: A convincing illusion of a bustling market scene fills the empty room, confronting the viewers with potentially frightening diversity and unexpected encounters.
Trial of Tolerance.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43] (master) to scratch out well-hidden key runes etched into the room's floor, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9. rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract the trial
Trial of Tolerance.reset: Once the room is empty of creatures, the trial deactivates and then resets after 1 minute has passed.
Trial of Tolerance.routine: (1 action; emotion, fear, illusion, mental) An unexpectedly aggressive or frightening looking figure, such as a Hellknight, demon, pirate, or cloaked assassin suddenly emerges from the crowd and quickly advances toward a randomly determined character in the room, then stands menacingly in their path until the end of the round before they appear to lose interest and drift back into the crowd. If the target has a type of fear or hatred toward a specific kind of creature, this unexpected figure epitomizes those fears and hatreds. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:46|traits:emotion,fear,illusion,mental] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2} on a critical failure). If any creature in the room takes any hostile action against the intimidating figure, the Trial of Tolerance uses its Reflective Violence reaction. Once three rounds pass without the Trial of Tolerance using Reflective Violence, the hazard deactivates.

action->Unveil the Bazaar.name: Unveil the Bazaar
action->Unveil the Bazaar.description:
Aktywator A creature begins its turn in area B2

Efekt A convincing illusion of an Ilizmagorti city bazaar appears, complete with a cloudless blue sky above. The surrounding crowd is dense, and the smells and sights and sounds are quite realistic even as no one in the crowd actually bumps against the PCs as they mill about. The Trial of Tolerance then rolls initiative.

action->Reflective Violence.name: Reflective Violence
action->Reflective Violence.description:
Aktywator A creature uses a hostile action against an illusory figure created by the Trial of Tolerance or fails at an attempt to disable the trap

Efekt The illusory figure effortlessly avoids the triggering action, then appears to attack the triggering creature using its most harrowing and violent option. Regardless of what this attack appears as, the triggering creature takes @Damage[(3d12+19)[mental]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save).

Trial of the Gods.name: Trial of the Gods
Trial of the Gods.description: What appears to be an eye opens within the glowing orb near the ceiling.
Trial of the Gods.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43] (master) to deactivate the glowing orb and prevent it from observing the room, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9. rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract the trial, @Check[religion|dc:45] (master) to perform a complex 5-round candle-lighting ritual, or placing General Ordulf's religious symbol on an empty hook on any wall as an Interact action
Trial of the Gods.reset: Once the room is empty of creatures, the trial deactivates and then resets after 1 minute has passed.
Trial of the Gods.routine: (1 action; death, emotion, fear, mental) The red eye glances at a randomly determined creature in area B3 that it can see and is not engaged in a candle-lighting ritual, then casts a 9. kręgu @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Jmxru8zMdYMRuO5n]{Vision of Death} on that target, causing them to experience the sight of Achaekek rising up from the ground to smite the transgressor for failing to honor the gods.

action->Wrath of the Gods.name: Wrath of the Gods
action->Wrath of the Gods.description:
Aktywator A creature attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick the Lock} on the eastern door, or ends a turn in this room while not performing the candle-lighting ritual

Efekt A glowing red eye manifests in the ceiling mounted orb to stare angrily at the triggering creature, who must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:46] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2} on a critical failure). The Trial of the Gods then rolls initiative.

action->Bolster the Wounded.name: Bolster the Wounded
action->Bolster the Wounded.description:
Aktywator The tempest ends its turn and is not at maximum HP

Efekt The tempest restores @Damage[5d10[healing]] HP. This healing can't increase a tempest's Hit Points beyond the maximum of its current Hit Point threshold.

action->Rain of Spears.name: Rain of Spears
action->Rain of Spears.description:
Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Efekt The tempest attacks with their electrified spears, targeting all adjacent enemies (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+10)[piercing],(1k12)[electricity]]{1k6+10 piercing damage plus 1k12 electricity}

2 @Damage[(2d6+10)[piercing],(2k12)[electricity]]{2k6+10 piercing damage plus 2k12 electricity}

3 @Damage[(3d6+10)[piercing],(3k12)[electricity]]{3k6+10 piercing damage plus 3k12 electricity}

action->Tempest of Battle.name: Tempest of Battle
action->Tempest of Battle.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt The tempest calls down a massive lightning storm in a @Template[emanation|distance:60]. Spears of lightning rain down upon enemies in the area, dealing @Damage[10d12[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save).

action->Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
action->Troop Movement.description: Whenever the troop Strides or Flies, they first Form Up as a free action into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then move up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

action->Troop Spellcasting.name: Troop Spellcasting
action->Troop Spellcasting.description: When the tempest Casts a Spell, its members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Valkyrie of Gorum.name: Valkyrie of Gorum
Valkyrie of Gorum.publicNotes:
Choosers of the slain and so-called angels of battle, the song of the valkyries plays wherever steel rings against steel. Valkyries are humanoid individuals of impressive physical stature who seek the most epic battles and legendary conflicts so that they can lay claim to the souls of the world's greatest warriors. The valkyries transform these souls into the implacable immortals known as einherjar.

Valkyries most often serve gods of battle and war, though a valkyrie might pledge their service to any deity they consider worthy. Gorum is particularly well known for having valkyrie and einherjar servants, though he isn't the only such deity. Besmara also has valkyrie servitors, and many stories of "ghost ships" actually reference accounts of encounters with ships manned by einherjar crews devoted to the Pirate Queen.

action->Claimer of the Slain.name: Claimer of the Slain
action->Claimer of the Slain.description: Valkyries can detect the souls of those recently slain in combat. A valkyrie spends 10 minutes praying over the body of a creature who has been dead for no more than 12 hours; if that creature is worthy of becoming an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-3.Actor.VF81W91YRFgtBLli]{Einherji} and of the appropriate alignment, the valkyrie transforms that creature into an einherji.

action->Ravenspeaker.name: Ravenspeaker
action->Ravenspeaker.description: Valkyries use ravens as servants and spies. They can speak with ravens, and they can have up to three raven servitors who follow their commands. Valkyries can constantly observe whatever their commanded ravens sense.

action->Recall the Fallen.name: Recall the Fallen
action->Recall the Fallen.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Aktywator An allied creature within 60 feet who isn't a construct or undead is reduced to 0 Hit Points and their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Umierający} value is 2 or less

Efekt The valkyrie restores @Damage[5d10[healing]] Hit Points to the target.

action->Storm of Battle.name: Storm of Battle
action->Storm of Battle.description: The valkyrie hurls her spear into the air, creating a massive storm in a @Template[burst|distance:100]. Spears of lightning rain down upon enemies in the area, dealing @Damage[4d12[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save).

Vatumledor.name: Vatumledor
Vatumledor.publicNotes:
Hidden among the shadows and upper echelons of society are the conspirator dragons. These dragons are schemers, always looking to manipulate and control others, either for personal gain or simply for the thrill of watching their machinations play out. Conspirator dragons see themselves above others and typically speak with infantilizing tones and words. However, as most conspirator dragons meet others while in disguise, they do their best to maintain their disguise.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Vatumledor.saveDetails: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

action->Telepathy 100 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]
Telepathy 100 feet

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occul.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kquBnQ0kObZztnBc]
+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

action->Retract Body.name: Retract Body
action->Retract Body.description:
Aktywator Vatumledor is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the dragon can see

Efekt Vatumledor retracts the targeted body part or twists away to avoid the attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to his Armor Class against the triggering attack.

action->Conjure Disguise.name: Conjure Disguise
action->Conjure Disguise.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt Vatumledor conjures a flesh suit that's a replica of a humanoid he has seen and compresses himself into the suit, along with clothing appropriate for the humanoid. This process takes 1 minute, during which Vatumledor is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda}. If he stops or is interrupted in this process, the suit is destroyed. Once the process is complete, he can remain in his disguise indefinitely.

The transformation has the effects of change shape, except that the disguise is not actively magical in nature and doesn't register as magical to detect magic and similar effects. Vatumledor loses Retract Body while transformed.

If Vatumledor is critically hit while wearing the disguise, the suit is destroyed, and immediately explodes. This has the effects of Detonate Disguise, except that creatures use the outcome one degree of success better than they rolled on their save.

action->Detonate Disguise.name: Detonate Disguise
action->Detonate Disguise.description:
Wymagania Vatumledor is wearing his conjured disguise

Efekt Vatumledor erupts from the disguise, destroying it. The explosive revelation deals @Damage[18d6[bludgeoning]] damage to creatures adjacent to the dragon (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic] save). Creatures that fail their save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Zamroczony} for 1 round as they become covered in scraps from the disguise. Any creatures sharing a space with Vatumledor after he erupts are pushed into the nearest empty space.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Smoczy Amok
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: Vatumledor makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

action->Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
action->Draconic Momentum.description: When Vatumledor scores a critical hit with a Strike, he recharges Smoke Breath.

action->Rushed Transformation.name: Rushed Transformation
action->Rushed Transformation.description:
Częstotliwość raz na godzinę

Efekt Vatumledor quickly reshapes his body into the form of a generic humanoid figure. This has the effects of humanoid form except that it only lasts 1 minute, and he doesn't gain the +4 status bonus to Deception as the transformation makes use of his own scales and plating to crudely mimic a humanoid form. Vatumledor can Dismiss the effect. Whenever the effect ends, Vatumledor leaves behind scraps of magically conjured flesh, which could give away his presence.

action->Smoke Breath.name: Smoke Breath
action->Smoke Breath.description: Vatumledor unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:60] of smoke that deals @Damage[16d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:39|basic] save). The smoke remains for 1 minute, obscuring sight with the effects of mist in the cone's area. He can't use Smoke Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Smoke Breath]]{1k4 rounds}.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Atak Ukradkowy
action->Sneak Attack.description: Vatumledor's Strikes deal an additional 3k6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} targets.

equipment->Iron Religious Symbol of Goru.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.plplsXJsqrdqNQVI]
Iron Religious Symbol of Gorum

action->Commanding Shout.name: Commanding Shout
action->Commanding Shout.description:
Vofnir commands the Gorumite infantry to fight for the glory of Gorum as long as the troop is within earshot. Until the start of Vofnir's next turn, the Gorumite infantry's save DCs for their Fire Crossbows! and Raise Swords! actions increase to DC 33 and they gain a +2 status bonus to their saving throws.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.F1JHRa75KBAjHOs1]{Efekt: Commanding Shout}

action->Consecrated.name: Consecrated
action->Consecrated.description: As long as the consecrate ritual effects persist in Crownhold, a Gorumite warpriest gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, skill checks, saving throws, and Perception checks; these bonuses are not calculated into the stat block.

action->Fervent Casting.name: Fervent Casting
action->Fervent Casting.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt The Gorumite warpriest loudly proclaims the glory of Gorum. The next divine spell they cast takes one fewer action (minimum of one), but must only target the warpriest. If the spell affects an area or multiple targets, such as bless, it only affects the warpriest, even if it lasts more than one round.

weapon->Zaiho's Gun Sword.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.10J0WjnfgRvriLXc]
Zaiho's Gun Sword
weapon->Zaiho's Gun Sword.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.10J0WjnfgRvriLXc]

Zaiho's innovation is an unusual-looking gun sword. He's enhanced this weapon with runes to become a +2 greater striking wounding weapon. He's further modified this weapon as follows:

  • He's given the sword a hooked tip and razor-sharp prongs, granting the weapon the disarm and trip traits with melee Strikes.
  • He's made the weapon lightweight. Zaiho's gun sword is 1 Bulk and only requires 1 hand to wield.
  • Strikes with the weapon deal an additional @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage.
  • He's revolutionized the damage output and increased the gun sword's base damage die of k8 to k10.

As an inventor innovation, Zaiho's gun sword only works due to his constant maintenance and tinkering, and anyone else is untrained in it and cannot use the special modifications listed in the bullet points above. Its weapon runes can be transferred to other weapons normally.

equipment->Obsidian Goggles (Greater).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Tej30MsQo8Ek9aA6]

The sleek, black lenses of these goggles somehow make everything seem more brightly lit. While wearing the goggles, you gain a +2 item bonus to Perception checks involving sight.

Aktywacja — Darkvision 1 (manipulacja)

Częstotliwość any number of times per day

Efekt Adjusting your goggles, you gain darkvision until you deactivate it as an Interact action or the item is no longer invested by you, whichever comes first.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.d7BDxmsnM1BUoEeT]{Efekt: Obsidian Goggles (Większy)}

action->Fiery Leap.name: Fiery Leap
action->Fiery Leap.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt Zaiho Leaps. As he does so, he throws a handful of explosive devices into a square he was adjacent to just before he Leaped. A creature in this square takes @Damage[11d10[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save); that creature and all creatures adjacent to the target square also take @Damage[(11[splash])[fire]]{11 fire splash} damage.

action->Gadget Defense.name: Gadget Defense
action->Gadget Defense.description:
Aktywator Zaiho would roll a saving throw against an effect that would cause Hit Point damage

Efekt Zaiho quickly procures some outlandish gadget or device from his pouches to protect himself from the triggering effect. Rather than roll the normal saving throw against the effect, Zaiho instead attempts a @Check[crafting] check in place of that saving throw, treating the result of this check as the result of the saving throw instead. If this results in a critical failure, Zaiho's gadgets are damaged, and he can no longer use this reaction for 24 hours.

action->Twinned Combat.name: Twinned Combat
action->Twinned Combat.description: Any enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} against Zaiho's Strikes if that enemy is currently taking persistent damage from or is frightened by any of Shirota's bombs. Zaiho doesn't inflict splash damage to Shirota with Fiery Leap.
